docTitle.titlePart: Coevaporation of Cu 2 ZnSnSe 4 thin films

front.div:
Cu 2 ZnSnSe 4 thin films grown by coevaporation are investigated in a wide temperature range and for
different Se partial pressures during growth. At temperatures higher than 350 ° C Sn is
re-evaporating as SnSe from the surface whereas Zn is lost at temperatures higher than 430 ° C.
Moreover the Se partial pressure dramatically changes the Zn and Sn concentrations in the resulting
film. Interrupted processes at 380 ° C show that single-stage coevaporation intrinsically induces a
secondary phase at the substrate/film interface.

The compound semiconductors Cu 2 ZnSnSe 4 ͑CZTSe͒
and Cu 2 ZnSnS 4 ͑CZTS͒ are promising candidates for the
next generation thin film solar cells. Compared to the current
high efficiency thin film solar cells Cu͑In, Ga͒Se 2 and CdTe
they are composed of elements with a higher abundance in
the Earth crust and a reduced toxicity.
A prerequisite for high efficiency solar cells is the
growth of single phase material which, according to theoret-
ical calculations is very demanding. The chemical potential
region for stable single phase material without unwanted sec-
ondary or ternary phases is very small.
